p: Myrcene, extracted together with other essential oil compounds from used hops, exhibited the highest repellency towards insect Rhyzopertha dominica (RD50 = 0.27 A mu M cm âˆ’2), whereas for yet another insect degrading stored foods Sitophilus granarius, limonene was the most effective repellent [ 139]. Therefore, not only fresh hops but even left-over hops from breweries can be effective at least as an insect repellent, protecting stored foods [ 139].
